content.description: Stand start and head up the face on bombers and a few slopers.
content.location: In between Sage and The Corridor

content.description:
Crouch start on good holds on the left arete. Make a long reach right. A jug awaits high on the right side of the lip but how do you get there?  Easier if you're tall but no less scary. Committing and incredible. Alex got a pretty big face full of heel when Michael fell on the crux.

Video started after the first few moves, sorry for not saying anything Kyle. Thanks for the awesome vid.

youtube.com/watch?v=W75sK3p…
content.protection: Pads and spotters, pretty bad landing.
content.location: Uphill face of the California/Jagurundi Boulder. Walk off behind Seige.

content.description: SDS matched on the huge sloper rail system and work your way on crimps to the face of the boulder. Finish up onto the slab
content.location: Same boulder as The Road to Zion just to the left.

content.description:
Hi-ball! SDS on the right under the roof. Match on the slopers and travel left to a glory jug on the lip.The lip above the slopers is off for hands. Mantle the boxy face on it's left side.  The move to the jug from the slopers is so satisfying.

Other Info:

I found this area in the summer of 2016 while running along game trails. I made it to about this boulder before totally getting lost in runners' high and staring at it for a while. I knew I had to come back with Alex, Kyle, Michael, and anyone else who was up for the adventure of clearing out the shattered glass and poison oak.
content.location: Though visible from the hike in it appears like nothing until you walk down the left side of the rock to find the problem facing the freeway. Just below "Back in the Saddle"

content.description:
A lip traverse along an overhang. SDS on the right side and move along the lip, around the corner, to end at a horn/ledge an arms throw across the crack. Step off from here. There are proving to be quite a few ways to move along the lip using the

sharp

holds, all variations are hovering around V0/1. Trying to top out looks like a bad idea. Earned it's name for being an excellent place to keep water and tools overnight instead of repeatedly hauling them out to the boulders every day.
content.protection: Not much help a spotter is gonna do for you though it never gets high off the ground. There's an awkward rock that a pad is good for near the crux.
content.location: Walking into the Irish boulders it will be the wall on your right as you descend. It turns into a flat area with an overhang.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the left arete, right hand palm down, and a high left foot. The skirt underneath is off. Use technical sequences to head right into the start of Sage and finish that problem straight up.
content.protection: Watch out for the oak tree by the start otherwise pretty safe.
content.location: In the alcove above the ethics project, left side of the Sage boulder.

content.description: Start crouched with your left hand on a small sidepull, right on a good open hand hold, and a good foot. Use holds along the arete to head straight up to a crux mantle.
content.location: To the left of the Corridor

content.description:
Start doubled up on same super jug for AOTCR (V2) but traverse low and left along the cave’s lip to get back into Jaguarundi and top out. Lots of compression and heel hook trickery on this one.

The bottom skirt of rock under the cave is OFF
content.location:
Ireland

Same Boulder as Jaguarundi and Assault on the Control Room and Thriller.

content.description: SDS on overhang with left hand on the lowest part of the rail and right hand on two finger crimp really low. Move along the rail till you mantle out of the cave and finish up slab
content.location: 40 yards above Sitting Bull and Three Wise Men. The lowball overhang before The Corridor on the left.

content.description: The backside of the Prism boulder has many great holds and features. See photos for basics but overall just have fun!
content.protection: Pad and a spotter maybe. The landing sucks but these routes are pretty easy especially once you get established.
content.location:
Around

From Dublin With Love

. The Prism is the large boulder opposite of the drop off jug of

Stellar Cellar

. Named for the glittery reflection of thick auto glass all over and around this boulder when we first found it. There is still a significant amount of sharp glass around this boulder.

content.description: SDS with two finger locks, pull in around a little edge and keep on finger Jammin till you run out of crack.
content.location: Crack found at the end of Stellar Cellar

content.description:
Start on bomber pockets under the cave section of the rock. Work up using okay hands and good feet till you can mantle out of the cave part (physical crux) and take the face of the climb head on. Mantle up to tall pinch then work feet up and look for slopey horn slightly left at the very top of the boulder (mental crux) Top is prolly V2 just scary.

The bottom skirt of rock is ON for this one.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter for sure
content.location: Irish Boulders. 15 yards above The Road to Zion and just before The Corridor

content.description: Head straight up the pockets on the slightly overhanging face.
content.location: To the left If only I had a brain

climbs.name: If I Only Had a Brain

content.description:
So far only one established route on this boulder. The downhill face and pretty much the entire top is super loose and

pulling big blocks off of this is a bad idea

- the slope wants to send your choss trundling into the freeway. Scary to imagine cannonballing a car. Be gentle.

SDS under the small roof at a low left undercling and a right at the pocket above the roof. Mantle the left side of the roof then pull the bulge to top out slightly left. The arete and everything right of it is off but mainly it's still very loose and shouldn't be used yet.

Gently

downclimb next to the rock pile, there is a ledge that leads to a pretty solid boulder that you can hop off.
content.location: Just down from SOIH on the Sugar Cube Boulder. Irish Boulders

content.description: Start low in a fist crack and stay in the crack till you can grab the top out jug.
content.location: On the trail that branches off Left from Stellar Cellar as you approach the boulders. From there it's the obvious almost off width crack. Down climb the same way you came up, with a little guidance from a spotter.

content.description: Start left hand in the massive hueco with a bomber kneebar, right hand in small pocket to the right of hueco. Bring one or both hands to the sloper lip and release the kneebar. Bump to jugs and top out direct.
content.location: Irish Boulders, immediately to the right of the Road to Zion.

content.description: The face next to The Stellar Cellar. SDS on the "saddle" rock and move through slopey holds to an attention getting top out
content.location: N. Face of Prism Boulder

content.description: Connects Back in the Saddle Again with the ending move of From Dublin With Love.
content.location: Prism Boulder

content.description:
Right next to the ending ledge of Stellar Cellar. SDS the rising lip problem from right to left on The Prism.  Right hand on a good sloper-ish hold, left hand pocket for the start. Sustained. Power over technique cause the feet are mud chips essentially. Will clean up nicely. Good heel hooking for short people. Rad little warmup.

Alex and I cleaned up what seemed like tons of thick broken glass. There is still

broken glass everywhere

which is a good reason for pads, some shards were huge and buried under soft dirt.
content.protection: A Pad or two for the start
content.location: A meter or two away from SC on The Prism Boulder

content.description: Climb up the dirty chimney
content.location: Irish Boulders. 50 yards above Sitting Bull and Three Wise Men.

content.description:
Start on the jugs to the right of jagurundi, mantle and balance along the ramp heading left to the good pinch, go up to the left leaning jug and mantle.

An equally adventurous though less committing variation by Alex has you pulling the starting mantle and then stepping up and right to a high feeling but secure finish to the right of a small bush.
content.location: To the right of jagurundi on the California Boulder in Upper Irish
